attributes.action: The Government should to its commitment on Foreign Aid
attributes.additional_details: The new Foreign Office permanent secretary, Sir Philip Barton, appearing at the foreign affairs select committee two weeks ago, provided no details on this year’s near £2.9bn cuts to aid, but said the department’s priorities were Covid health requirements, girls’ education, climate change and biodiversity, the “bottom billion” poorest people and defending open societies, human rights and “force-for-good” programming.
attributes.background: The Government should keep to its commitment to spending 0.7% of GDP on Foreign Aid.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/561068
